attributes.action: Supermarkets to give delivery and store priority to the elderly and vulnerable
attributes.additional_details: With Covid-19 affecting everyones lives people over 70 and those with underlying health conditions are advised to isolate for 12 weeks but with the country stockpiling there are unable to get their usual weekly shop. Supermarket delivery is overwhelmed and they are not receiving the items they order, including milk, eggs, cheese and bread! Big changes need to be made to ensure they are safe and fed! Please put them as top priority and put measures in place to stop stockpiling!
attributes.background: Elderly/most vulnerable(carers on behalf) able to book supermarket deliveries to have priority before everyone else. For all supermarkets to offer early opening times and support for them. And to put strong measures in place to stop stock piling!

rejection.details:
The opening arrangements for supermarkets are a matter for individual retailers, not the Government or Parliament. A number of retailers have announced plans to open early for elderly or vulnerable customers, and prioritise them for home delivery. You should contact your local supermarket to find out if they have put such arrangements in place.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
